CRYSTAL BEASLEY

wrap yourself in pixels

DAWN PICKA

Crystal begins each scarf with an image of a person caught in a moment of action. The raw materials of the piece come from a painting by one of the few female Art Deco painters, Tamara Lempicka. Those original pixels were morphed through hundreds of transformations, duplications and remixes. It pays homage to a Surrealists’ sunrise. Or perhaps it’s a Mandelbrot in shimmering color. What do you find in it?

This scarf is 100% silk crepe de chine

130cm x 200 cm
Made in the USA

Price upon request

LAKE PICKA

Crystal begins each scarf with an image of a person caught in a moment of action. The raw materials of the piece come from a painting by one of the few female Art Deco painters, Tamara Lempicka. Those original pixels were morphed through hundreds of transformations, duplications and remixes. It pays homage to a Surrealists’ sunrise. Or perhaps it’s a Mandelbrot in shimmering color. What do you find in it?

This scarf is 100% wool gauze

130cm x 200 cm
Made in the USA

Price upon request

CHILI LADYBOY

Crystal begins each scarf with an image of a person caught in a moment of action. The raw materials of the piece come from a painting by one of the few female Art Deco painters, Tamara Lempicka. Those original pixels were morphed through hundreds of transformations, duplications and remixes. It pays homage to a Surrealists’ sunrise. Or perhaps it’s a Mandelbrot in shimmering color. What do you find in it?

This scarf is 100% silk twill

130cm x 130 cm
Made in the USA

Price upon request

This project to document put pixels on thread is by Crystal Beasley a.k.a. @skinny. I have a lifelong fascination with behavior and ritual, especially those where the participants reach some trance-like state. I experienced this firsthand in the form of speaking in tongues as a member of a fundamentalist church in the American South. These images capture a moment of transcendence.

I to hear from you:
